content.description: The route sit-starts in the cream colored rock in between the black and orange streak, on the lowest left facing flake/edge, and moves up an right to small, left-facing hold before moving left into a sidepull, crossing and traversing left on the edge and crack system. Top out where the boulders sandwich together. See the photos for detail. The photo is old, and the rating might be off. Downclimb the southeast arete or traverse the sandwiched boulder.
content.location: It is on the east side of Gash Block, in the middle, and perhaps a fire ring is in the way of the start.

content.description: This is an enjoyable, overhanging arete on Gash Block. Follow pockets edges and the arete to a sloping ramp topout. Downclimb the corner, or traverse onto the adjacent boulder, and walk off.
content.location: It is on the southeast corner of Gash Block.

content.description: This route climbs out of the scoop directly behind Chiseled Arete Bloc. It starts as low as you can get on a sandy feature, then it busts straight out using sidepulls and underclings. Find a way to throw out to the lip (and hold), to find bigger holds questing through the upper slab.
content.location: This is located directly behind (west) Chiseled Arete. There are two giant boulders with some good warm-ups in the cave, and this route is located just outside the cave. You can't miss it, it is a giant scoop-like feature.
